required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Oscillatory Versus Non-Oscillatory Nasal Continuous Airway Pressure Neonatal Respiratory Support
clinical_study.official_title: Oscillatory Versus Non-Oscillatory Nasal Continuous Airway Pressure Neonatal Respiratory Support

brief_summary.textblock: This study will seek to enroll neonates requiring Nasal Continuous Airway Pressure (NCPAP) respiratory support and randomize them to either oscillatory (Osc-NCPAP, study group) or non-oscillatory (NCPAP, control group) mode. The goal of the research is to determine if Osc-NCPAP provides improved ventilation support compared to routine NCPAP, i.e. NCPAP without oscillations. This will be measured by need for change to ventilator support, improvement in pCO2 values, and reduction in respiratory rate and frequency of apnea during the period of NCPAP treatment. Other respiratory outcomes will also be compared, including time on NCPAP, time on High-Flow Nasal Cannula support following NCPAP, and time-averaged PiO2 from start of study to end of respiratory treatment.

primary_outcome.measure: Physiologic respiratory stability of Oscillating versus Non-Oscillating NCPAP
primary_outcome.description: Determine the physiologic respiratory stability (pCO2, respiratory rate, apnea frequency) during treatment with NCPAP

primary_outcome.measure: Need for mechanical ventilation following the initiation of NCPAP.
primary_outcome.description: The rate of mechanical ventilation following both Oscillating and Non-Oscillating groups.

secondary_outcome.measure: Total duration of non-invasive and invasive respiratory support in each study group.
secondary_outcome.description: Determine the total duration of non-invasive and invasive respiratory support in each study group.

secondary_outcome.measure: total amount of oxygen exposure in each study group. Total amount of oxygen exposure in each study group.
secondary_outcome.description: Determine the total amount of oxygen exposure in each study group.

arm_group.description: NCPAP will be given to infant via prongs in the infant's nose. A Bird Industries pneumatic oscillating diaphragm to drive a Bird Industries phasatron which is attached by T-connector to the NCPAP patient circuit.

intervention.description: NCPAP is delivered via nasal prongs placed into infant's nares. It may be delivered via ventilator or by bubble.
Bird Industries pneumatic diaphragm is attached to NCPAP patient circuit to provide oscillations.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Newborn (0-28 days of age) admitted to Neonatal Intensive Care Unit (NICU)
- Ordered respiratory treatment of NCPAP
Exclusion Criteria:
- Major congenital defect
- Known or suspected chromosomal disorder

facility.name: University of Utah Health Sciences Center

responsible_party.organization: University of Utah / Primary Childrens Medical Center
